right on up to your elbows.

would have guessed that you were so uptight.

you used to do anything, you know, for your roles.

that you've become, like, so bourgeois, you know, with those shitty romcoms and the...

that you are still a legitimate actress.

gun pops whooping and shouting Come on.

classical music âª âª monitors beeping distantly  Stay with us, pal.

Baxter, can you do that, buddy?
I shot you in the head.
What do you want me to say?
Tell us about what you're writing.
I got a new book, but I'm a little writer's blocked.
Oh, well, maybe we can help you out.
a brother and a sister, and they run away from an orphanage.
But they get caught by a pit master.
It's just a guy who has an arena underground and forces them to fight for sport.
I don't know. I don't know.
Let me just take a little nap.
What's going on with my ear?
You'll be fine in a few weeks.
No flying for a while, though.
You'll feel better when your people get here.
Well, we went through your wallet.
They're driving up to get you.
jazzy bass music Caleb and Camille Fang are most known for creating improvised public events that incorporate their own children into the artwork.
The results are often as unsettling as they are arresting.
In one of their earliest works, Caleb Fang walked through a crowded roller skating rink carrying his infant daughter.
Suddenly, a series of homemade flarelike devices he had taped to his back began to discharge.
Camille captured the event from the rink's second level.
The Fangs simply throw themselves into a space as if they were hand grenades, and wait for the disruption to occur.
They seemed to have no expectations other than to willfully cause unrest.
inaudible audience gasping This kind of event is so rudimentary, so unencumbered by the traditions that have come before it, that it almost strains the notion of what constitutes art.
laughs You can... that's not fair.
I mean, you know, whether or not you like the Fangs' work, you can't deny the artistry, certainly.
Look, the Fangs pass off these hollow pranks as if that's enough.
You can say the same thing about the diggers, or the situationists, or the Dadaists for that matter.
But if you care to look a little deeper, you'll find that the Fangs transcend what...
in the... in the pageant piece, they challenged gender stereotypes.
In the restaurant piece, they ask us to look at food not as sustenance, but as status or style.
Just because... just because you attach a statement doesn't make it art, you know?
You can call it art but real art requires an aesthetic intelligence.
But that ambiguity is what makes it interesting.
Is it art or is it a joke?
Is it profound or is it a prank?
These are the questions that they want us to ask.
Well, they're not too hard to answer.
And the Fangs are challenging the very nature of art itself.
They embrace everything that's wonderful about art, and they subvert it at the same time.
They are deeply serious class clowns who celebrate...
I... I think what they're doing is wonderful.
Well, I guess... I guess I just don't get it.
So the truth is making a movie is really...
it's a strange process, you know?
Always requires some sort of degree of weirdness.
Is that why you took off your top?
I took off my top because...
well, because I wanted to prove to myself that I could do it.
I've never done a nude scene before, so what the hell, right?
laughs Did Sally tell you that this was...
sighs This is a very important article for me.
They say I'm in a bit of a...
Precarious position right now careerwise, and then I have to, I don't know...
You don't have to worry about that.
whispering Thank you, but I do.
Well, you can relax, because I don't care about your meltdowns.
I'm actually more interested in your family.
you're not going to put that in the article, I hope.
How could I leave it out?
Are you always so jumpy when someone mentions your parents?
It doesn't come up often, actually.
I wrote my thesis on their work.
That's why I wanted to do this story.
Do you think you'll ever do another piece with them?
It must have been fun, though.
But I'm not a child anymore.
Anyway, your readers don't want to hear about this.
They don't want to hear about weirdo performance art.
Look, I think you're a great actress.
But the artist you are, don't you think she was already there in child A?
It's too bad none of your directors have known how to channel all that the way your parents did.
It was a role I played.
What are you doing up there?
I got shot in the head.
I got shot in the head.
But, you know, I'm not dying, so...
You got shot in the head?
Who shot you in the head?
It's not why I'm calling, though.
Come on, are you on drugs?
Mmhmm. Would you call me back when you're lucid?
The doctors will not let me leave.
And Mom and Dad are bringing me home to recuperate.
Mom and Dad are on their way.
You got to come get me.
Look, I'm in my pajamas and I'm 3,000 miles away.
Well, I can't go back home.
I can't go back home by myself.
I'm going to help you out, but I'm just... I need a day to sort a few things out.
I'm in a really weird place right now.
Are you in a weird place, Annie?
I almost got killed by a potato.
I'm sending you a plane ticket.
You can come and stay with me.
No, no, I can't fly, Annie.
So tell them you can't go.
Just stand up to them, Baxter.
When have I ever done that?
The point is, I call in a favor.
I line up this guy from "Esquire." And you decide to nail him?
You could get away with this a few years ago, okay?
Everybody likes a little shoplifting with their starlet.
A little DUI here and again.
Yes, there was a nice lull in the middle years, you know?
But things are starting to get a little loopy again.
You know? And I know the good offers aren't coming in.
But you can't panic about it.
I can get back on track.
You know, you have the impulse control of a 2yearold.
Listen, if you are, I know a couple places.
I just... I need a project.
I mean, what about the start date on "Powers the Bee 3"?
You're going to have to talk to Gordon about that.
I think you should hear it from him.
They offered "Lady Lightning" to Alison Cane.
Look at this as a good thing.
You don't have to wear that ridiculous costume anymore.
We'll get you a better one.
In the meantime, I think you need to take a step back.
I think you just have to have a real sitdown with yourself.
I don't even know what that means.

it was good to see you.

it is a possible scenario, yes.

and I couldn't get it out of my head.
and you don't want to think about it.

well, my sister and I don't have relatives.

we get taken to an orphanage.
